Yes, the unexpected relationship between Donkey and Dragon was a great example of the development team's creative approach to storytelling in Shrek. Despite their vastly different personalities and appearances, Donkey and Dragon were able to connect on an emotional level, demonstrating that love and friendship can come from unexpected places.

The development of Donkey and Dragon's relationship also helped to further develop their individual characters, demonstrating that even minor characters in a story can have depth and complexity. By the end of the movie, the audience is invested in their relationship and feels a sense of satisfaction when they overcome the obstacles they faced earlier in the film.

Overall, the character development in Shrek was one of the film's greatest strengths, allowing audiences to connect with the characters on a deeper level and making the story more emotionally resonant.
